Dataset:

Small Area Population Estimates 2014

This is not the latest release

View latest release

28 April 2015

We published corrected UK population estimates for the years 2012 to 2014 incorporating corrected estimates for Scotland on 28 April 2016.

They address the previously announced error of the age distribution in the council areas of Scotland presented in the last release published 25 June 2015. These errors only affect areas within Scotland; population estimates for England, Wales and Northern Ireland are unaffected. Whilst the estimated age distribution of the UK population is affected for the period, the total estimates of the UK population remain valid. Further information on the causes of the errors, their impact and how decisions were reached on the approach taken is available in the Quality Management Information document available on the ONS website.

Contact:
Tom Davy

Release date:
22 June 2015

Next release:
June 2016

Dataset ID:
TD2017 What's this?

About this dataset

Estimates of the usual resident population for Lower Layer Super Output Areas (LSOAs) in England and Wales by Broad Age and Sex.

Release frequency: Yearly

What has changed in this edition?

Change in classification

Privatisation of organisations previously included in the public sector.

Download options

Download complete dataset

Download metadata (CSV, 3.6kb)

Previous releases of this data are available

Dataset notes

To protect the confidentiality of individuals personal information, this dataset provides data only for districts that have a minimum of 150 people.

Usage information

Free for public use.

Source: Office for National Statistics, Small Area Population Estimates, June 2017

Terms & conditions

Language

Available in English only.
